source.description:
Place
of whole blood into a 10 ml volume centrifuge tube.

Add
of dextran solution and mix well by drawing in and out of a pipette.

source.title: Dextran

source.description:
Incubate in the dark for
at

Place
of Fycoll-HyPaque media solution into a 10 ml volume centrifuge tube.
Slowly and carefully layer the supernatant from blood/dextran mixture onto the Fycoll-HyPaque media solution.

source.body: Important: when layering the sample, do not mix the Fycoll-HyPaque media solution and supernatant.

source.description:
Centrifuge at
with no brake.
Draw off the mononuclear cell layer at the Ficoll/plasma interface along with plasma and Ficoll media, leaving the white cell layer of granulocytes above the red blood cell layer undisturbed.

Resuspend the remaining cell layer in
of NaCl 0.15 M and centrifuge at

source.title: NaCl

source.description: Aspirate the supernatant with a plastic pipette Pasteur.

Lyse remaining red blood cells in
of
hypotonic lysis buffer
for
Centrifuge at
Aspirate the supernatant with a plastic Pasteur pipette.

Resuspend the pellet in
NaCl 0.15 M.

NaCl 0.15 M for cell counting.

source.description:
Mix
of cell suspention with an equal amount of Türk solution (diluition factor=2) allow mixture
at Room temperature (RT).
Take
of the mixture and place it inside a Bürker chamber and view under an optical microscope using 40x magnifiation
Count cell in each square found in the four corners and in the central square (figure 1 below), including those that lie on the bottom and left-hand perimeters, but not those that lie on the top and right hand perimeters (see figure 2 below).
Total number of cell per ml = mean number of cell x diluition factor x 104 (hemacitometer volume)
Figure 1
The gridded area of the chamber consists of nine 1 mmq squares. These squares are subdivided in three directions; 0.0625 mmq, 0.05 mmq and 0.04 mmq. The central square here in Figure 1 is further subdivided into 0.0025 mmq = 1/25 mmq squares. Count cells in 5 squares as shown.
Figure 2
Concerning those cells that lay on the perimeter of the square, count following this scheme.

source.title: Türk solution and Trypan Blue

OPTIONAL STEP
For automatic cell count with Cellometer machines use Trypan Blue. The machine will calculate the number of cells /ml and the % of viability.
Take
of cell suspension and add an equal amount of Trypan Blue. Use all the volume to place it in a counting chamber. Place the chamber inside Cellometer and count.

source.description: {"blocks":[{"key":"aat76","text":"This recepe is used in the following protocols:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"apn3r","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"dj337","text":"- Separation and purification of human PBMC from FRESH BLOOD","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"dlegc","text":"- Separation and purification of human PBMC from BUFFY COAT","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"9okek","text":"- Magnetic bead-based CD4+ T cell isolation from PBMCs with Dynabeads: CD4 Positive Isolation Kit","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"6moa5","text":"- Magnetic bead-based TREG-TEFF cell isolation from PBMC with Miltenyi CD4+CD25+ Regulatory T cell Isolation Kit","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"9ilmt","text":"- Separation of Human Neutrophils (PMN) from Buffy Coat","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"bgh3u","text":"- Separation of Human Neutrophils (PMN) from Whole Blood","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[]}

OPTIONAL STEP
If needed, check the purity of PMN suspension by using morphological parameters of the flow cytometer.
For this test 0,5x106 PMN in
of PBS are enough.

8 g (137 mM)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":4,"offset":0,"style":"bold"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"d5vr9","text":"KCl - 0.2 g (2.7 mM)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":4,"offset":0,"style":"bold"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"et7oh","text":"Na2HPO4 - 1.44 g (10 mM)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":7,"offset":0,"style":"bold"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"2rtbf","text":"KH2PO4 - 0.24 g (1.8 mM)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":6,"offset":0,"style":"bold"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"1aiq9","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"2nh4k","text":"To prepare 1 L of PBS 1X, dissolve the reagents listed above in 800 mL of ultrapure H2O.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"9d7ao","text":"Adjust the pH to 7.4 with HCl or NaOH, and then add H2O to 1 L.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"1vrqp","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"8epja","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"a05d8","text":"NaCl code: S9625, Sigma","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":10,"offset":0,"style":"bold"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"dl8qu","text":"KCl code: P9541, Sigma","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":9,"offset":0,"style":"bold"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"19msp","text":"Na2HPO4 code: 1.06585, Sigma","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":13,"offset":0,"style":"bold"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"4cko6","text":"KH2PO4 code: P0662, Sigma","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":13,"offset":0,"style":"bold"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"3f8u5","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"cmlsp","text":"Fonte: (Cold Spring Harbor Laboratory Press 2006)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":49,"offset":0,"style":"bold"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[]}

EXPECTED RESULTS

source.body:
VIABILITY: the expeted viability by Tripan Blue shuold be ≥90%
CELL YIELD: ± 1 x106 cells starting from 1 mL of Whole Blood

description:
Separation of Human Neutrophils (PMN) from Buffy Coat: list of published papers using this protocol
- Boydum A.Isolation of mononuclear cells and granulocytes from human blood. Scand.J.Clin.Lab. Invest. 21 (Suppl.97): 77-89, 1968
- Alex Mabou Tagne, Franca Marino, Massimiliano Legnaro, Alessandra Luini, Barbara Pacchetti and Marco Cosentino. A Novel Standardized Cannabis sativa L. Extract and Its Constituent Cannabidiol Inhibit Human Polymorphonuclear Leukocyte Functions. Int J Mol Sci2019 Apr; 20(8): 1833. Published online 2019 Apr 13. doi: 10.3390/ijms20081833.
- Angela Scanzano, Laura Schembri, Emanuela Rasini, Alessandra Luini, Jessica Dallatorre, Massimiliano Legnaro, Raffaella Bombelli, Terenzio Congiu, Marco Cosentino, Franca Marino. Adrenergic Modulation of Migration, CD11b and CD18 Expression, ROS and interleukin-8 Production by Human Polymorphonuclear Leukocytes. Inflamm Res. 2015 Feb;64(2):127-35. doi: 10.1007/s00011-014-0791-8. Epub 2015 Jan 6.
